PolicyPage.Name: Coming Early to School
PolicyPage.Title: Can I start living in Approved Housing before I start school?
PolicyPage.Abstract: Approved Housing is reserved for current students of the University. To live in Approved Housing before you become an official student, you need to petition to come early. Click for more information.
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Students that have been admitted to a track and would like to live in Approved Housing for the semester before his/her assigned track start date are required to complete the Petition for Exception to Policy form. This form will be submitted to the Admission's Office where it will be reviewed and then either approved or denied by their committee. Individuals that have not been admitted to the university submitting a petition will not have his/her petition reviewed until after his/her admittance.


Students that have already received a registration approval to attend BYU-Idaho, such as with the Pre-Missionary Program or Quest program, are not required to submit this petition to live in Approved Housing.
